intro: Chisocheton peekelianus, commonly known as the Pekelean's chisocheton, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with five petals. It produces woody fruits that contain flat, winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
